instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3662 funky trackpad on internal SSD
threads.message:
Liquid damaged board.

Boot into:
OS on external drive, all is good.
ASD no errors at all.
Instaler USB, all is good.

Boot into SSD internal and the trackpad cuts out and in. Put a known working SSD in there and same thing. Also some odd screen behaviour on internal SSD.
I will inspect for damage a little further but does anyone have expirience with this?

Oh, new trackpad, new battery fitted.

threads.title: 820-3662 funky trackpad on internal SSD
threads.message: Corrosion on trackpad connector? Ran ASD with SSD plugged in?

threads.title: 820-3662 funky trackpad on internal SSD
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 22847"]Corrosion on trackpad connector? Ran ASD with SSD plugged in?[/QUOTE]

No corrosion. First thing I checked.
Yes ran ASD with internal SSD plugged in.

I was expecting some sort of SSD thermal sensor issue but nothing!
Everything running perfect on an external drive.

I'll inpesct again and sonic the shit out of it
